storyInfo: After the battle at the walls, the defeat of the Sarkaz has led to more chaos in the city. Nowell helps Clovisia, leader of the Self-Salvation Corps, save the innocent citizens. He witnesses her death and lets his obsession go.

attributes.content: Stay close to me, Ollie!
attributes.name: Panicked Woman

attributes.content: You've got to stick close if you don't want me carrying you! Grab onto my clothes, okay?
attributes.name: Panicked Woman

attributes.content: Mummy can't hold your hand right now... my palms are all slippery with sweat! So, grab on tight to my clothes.
attributes.name: Panicked Woman

attributes.content: (Nods)
attributes.name: Quiet Child

attributes.content: Colin! Colin?! Where are you? Is there a way out?
attributes.name: Panicked Woman

attributes.content: Oh no, oh no! This isn't going to work! We should head back home and hide! Ollie's too little for this!
attributes.name: Panicked Woman

attributes.content: Colin—
attributes.name: Panicked Woman

attributes.content: Ah!
attributes.name: Panicked Woman

attributes.content: Over here! I found a way! The Exemplars are drawing the devils away! If we can avoid the explosions—
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: 'Avoid the explosions'?! Do you remember how Schwall from the grocer tripped and fell on that patch of red glow?
attributes.name: Panicked Woman

attributes.content: It was only a palm-sized wound, but it bled him dry. Did you forget?
attributes.name: Panicked Woman

attributes.content: It's like the blood was sucked right out of him... Can you really call that just an 'explosion'?
attributes.name: Panicked Woman

attributes.content: It's because his wound never healed! We'll be fine as long as we're careful not to get cut or scraped.
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: The one thing we can't do, is turn back.
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: The explosion just now sounded too close! I'd rather head back than die halfway without knowing what's happening.
attributes.name: Panicked Woman

attributes.content: Your grandmother's still in the city—
attributes.name: Panicked Woman

attributes.content: Going back now would only mean more danger.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: You're—
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: We can't say for sure that all the Sarkaz have left the lockdown zone.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: You came from outside? Are you with the Exemplars? Are you here to help us? Please!
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: ...Sorry, I'm not with the Exemplars, and I'm not here to rescue people.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: I only came to Londinium to look for someone.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Who could be so important that you'd wear out your shoes running around Londinium at the time like this looking for them?
attributes.name: Panicked Woman

attributes.content: But if you're not with the Exemplars, then you're just another poor sod like us. Let's go back, Colin...
attributes.name: Panicked Woman

attributes.content: *sigh*
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: The man sighs and looks around cautiously.
The optician has returned to Londinium for the first time in many years. But the view he sees now is as if he is looking at the city through a lens in the heat of his workshop, blurred and distorted.
By the time the image clears up, the only thing he can see is chaos. Trying to find an elusive presence in this bedlam will be no easy task, let alone someone whose appearance he does not even know.
Could you show us the way out, good sir? I'll give you everything I have!
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: If you managed to enter the lockdown zone without a scratch, you must know a safe route. Please...
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: The gaunt man empties his pockets, takes out a few pieces of bread from a bag, and tries to stuff them into Nowell's hands. The woman also takes out what few coins she has on her.
Nowell does not take them. He shakes his head, knowing that it is a thin line that separates these three people from the exsanguinated corpse by the roadside.
And he stands behind that tiny divide, always a spectator.
He has tried to reach out before, but his hands cannot save everyone.
I'm sorry...
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Sir!
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: Let's go, Colin. It's no use...
attributes.name: Panicked Woman

attributes.content: There's no other way!
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: ...I'm not with the Exemplars, but I know where their camp is.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: I can take you there.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: ...! Th-Thank you! Thank you so much!
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: But that's all I can do.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: I-It's plenty! We'll go with you!
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: What about your grandmother, Colin?
attributes.name: Panicked Woman

attributes.content: We'll come back for her once it's all over. The devils may be cruel, but even they wouldn't hurt the helpless old folks in the Sanatorium...
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: Right?
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: I'll lead you out. After that...
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: You're on your own.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: That's plenty, good sir, I couldn't possibly ask for any more. Thank you so much!
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: ...No need to thank me. Grab your child and follow me.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: This way.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: This path will take you straight to the city walls.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: The Exemplars have set up camp around a breach in the wall.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: You could also seek refuge with the ducal alliance's army outside.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: We...
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: What about you, sir? I gather you aren't coming with us.
attributes.name: Panicked Woman

attributes.content: You saved our lives. I don't know how you did it, but if there's anything we can do for you...
attributes.name: Panicked Woman

attributes.content: No need. My wounds have healed.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Even—even with your unique talents, the cannons won't show you any more mercy than they do us. You should come with us... you're Victorian too.
attributes.name: Panicked Woman

attributes.content: No. I've... I've come this far.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: I have to find the one I'm looking for. I have no reason to stop.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: You mentioned you were looking for someone. Who?
attributes.name: Panicked Woman

attributes.content: This is not the first time she's asked, but it is the first time she hears something other than calmness in his voice.
The numerous wounds the man took, which should have killed him many times over, have all healed. Any bleeding quickly stopped, and even Sarkaz Arts Circles could not affect him.
Only the pain persists. Even so, he clenches his fist.
I'm looking for...
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: The one who gave me this 'talent'.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Wh-What do we do, sir?
attributes.name: Frightened Woman

attributes.content: This way. I'll shield you. Leave before the next barrage begins—
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: O-Out of the way!
attributes.name: Frantic Man

attributes.content: Today I'm finally getting out of this hellhole!
attributes.name: Frantic Man

attributes.content: Out of the way!
attributes.name: Frantic Man

attributes.content: Stay back, sir.
Children and the elderly have priority.
The hell they do—
attributes.name: Frantic Man

attributes.content: The Self-Salvation Corps' evacuation route is the safest way. If you insist on leaving on your own...
Be my guest.
...Who are you?
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Me? I'm the leader of the Londinium Self-Salvation Corps. You can call me Clovisia.
I heard someone has been helping evacuate the citizens in this district. We appreciate your assistance.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: The Self-Salvation Corps will take it from here.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: I can still help.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: It's dangerous. We can't ask you to risk your life for others.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: We cannot promise a reward either.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: No, you don't understand.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: I'm afraid we don't have time to discuss this...
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: *sigh*
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Long story short, let's just say I've got a sort of curse on me. There's no need to worry about my safety. I'll cover you to help more people evacuate.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Besides, I'm still looking for someone here.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: That's the last of them...
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Where is that Self-Salvation Corps leader... Clovisia?
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Nowell looks around and grabs a man who looks like a worker passing by.
Excuse me—
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Ouch!
attributes.name: Injured Worker

attributes.content: ...Sorry. I didn't notice that your other arm was injured.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: I can treat your wound if you like.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Never mind. What do you want?
attributes.name: Injured Worker

attributes.content: Have you seen Clovisia, the leader of the Self-Salvation Corps?
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: She was leading groups of citizens being evacuated. We agreed to meet back here before splitting up, but I haven't seen her.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: The citizens have been led to safety. As for her, she's probably still organizing the final evacuation efforts.
attributes.name: Injured Worker

attributes.content: I can't be sure, though. We're all busy, after all.
attributes.name: Injured Worker

attributes.content: So she was here earlier?
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Seems like your routes are quicker and safer than mine.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: We know the Londinium underground better, but nothing's completely safe.
attributes.name: Injured Worker

attributes.content: Clovisia is needed at the frontline, guiding citizens away from the remaining Sarkaz mercs. You might find her in the lockdown zone, if you're not afraid of the devils' traps.
attributes.name: Injured Worker

attributes.content: You seem to have rescued quite a few people yourself. You might be able to help out.
attributes.name: Injured Worker

attributes.content: ...Thank you.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: —Sir! Good sir!
attributes.name: Panicked Woman

attributes.content: Have you seen my Ollie? My son, with the red-hair. Quiet boy, only about as tall as my knee. Have you seen him?
attributes.name: Panicked Woman

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: My son, he's gone... I lost him!
attributes.name: Panicked Woman

attributes.content: Ollie—
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: Bloody hell, where did he go?
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: He kept asking about your grandmother, Colin... Maybe he was worried...
attributes.name: Panicked Woman

attributes.content: Have you searched the area?
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Y-Yes! The folks who came with us helped out too. The only place left is the lockdown zone, but...
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: That doesn't bother me. I'll go.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: But Clovisia is—
attributes.name: Injured Worker

attributes.content: Just tell her I've already brought those people out safely.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: I'll go with you!
attributes.name: Panicked Woman

attributes.content: No, you stay here.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: No, I mean Clovisia is back!
attributes.name: Injured Worker

attributes.content: With a red-haired child in her arms!
attributes.name: Injured Worker

attributes.content: —What? Where are they?
attributes.name: Panicked Woman

attributes.content: Everyone looks in the direction the man is pointing.
That was when everything went wrong...
No...
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: —Everybody, get back!
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: It's Ollie! She has Ollie!
attributes.name: Panicked Woman

attributes.content: Don't go!
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Nowell only has time to grab the hysterical woman.
A flash of red as far as the eye can see, and then the ground opens up like a gaping maw, swallowing the leader of the Self-Salvation Corps.
All eyes are trained on the epicenter of the tremor. The one within it holds the child tightly in her arms until the very end.
The dust cloud disperses, and all is quiet again, for now.
Partings like this have become a familiar sight to the people here. The outcome never changes, regardless of the victim.
*cough* *cough*...
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Wait! Keep your distance—
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Nowell knows all too well that there can sometimes be secondary explosions or aftershocks.
Ollie... Ollie!
attributes.name: Panicked Woman

attributes.content: Get a search party together! Anyone who can still move!
attributes.name: Injured Worker

attributes.content: S-Sir! You're still here! Please, help Ollie—
attributes.name: Panicked Woman

attributes.content: You're not afraid of the devils' traps, your wounds heal quickly, and you're so brave... Could you at least, b-bring him back...
attributes.name: Panicked Woman

attributes.content: He's still so little...
attributes.name: Panicked Woman

attributes.content: In Nowell's long life, there have been precious few things he was able to control. He has an ocean of memories, but it is not up to him which ones float to the surface.
Like an ordinary mortal, he can be distracted by flashbacks of the past that seem to overlap with the present as he gathers the weight of all those years.
This will do.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Are you sure this is where we stop? Are you sure...
attributes.name: Distant Voice

attributes.content: ...you won't stay?
attributes.name: Distant Voice

attributes.content: He's still so little...
attributes.name: Distant Voice

attributes.content: My youngest child, he doesn't even know the word 'grandpa' yet...
attributes.name: Distant Voice

attributes.content: ...Too long.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: It's been too long, my child.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: I should have gone with your mother, but I've waited so long, long enough for you to grow older than your father.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: I've accomplished nothing, spent my life in hesitation, and lingered in this world for far too long. So long, in fact, that I've become a stranger to the children.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: If there is one way to end my fate as a bystander...
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Now is the time.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Nowell looks towards the scene of the explosion and collapse. In the hole formed from brick and rubble, he seems to see visions of a dark mire from a century past.
It was a morning like this. He had heard the same pleading, which he had, stubbornly, chosen to ignore, instead setting upon a path in search of a death that could never come. This time...
He will not make the same choice again.
...Clovisia shielded the child's head before she fell.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Sir—
attributes.name: Panicked Woman

attributes.content: There's at least a chance that Ollie survived, but no more than a chance. But that's enough...
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: I will go and find them.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Guided by the Self-Salvation Corps, Nowell attempts to enter the underground ruins, helped by his years of experience and sheer immortality.
About three hundred meters to the west...
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: His steps are light and brisk, never stopping, until the sight before his eyes changes.
A red-headed child lies quietly beside a pile of collapsed rubble, near the remnants of an activated Arts Circle.
(Soft breathing)
attributes.name: Child

attributes.content: He hurries forward and takes the child into his arms. The boy's chest rises and falls rhythmically with his breathing.
He could have been asleep in bed, if not for the ash and gravel in his hair.
Phew...
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Just passed out, no serious injuries. He was left here by himself, but he didn't fall here directly...
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Looks like I made it in time.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Clovisia could be nearby. She put Ollie here—
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Clovisia! Are you there?
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: If you hear me, knock on something hard—
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Clovisia?
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Can you...
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: He takes a few steps, and comes face-to-face with the truth.
The young Self-Salvation Corps leader is half-buried in rubble, not stirring in the slightest.
Her eyelids are shut gently, naturally, as though she is only sleeping. Will she sleep here forever, underground?
A moment of pain in a fall that lasted seconds at most, leaving behind only peace. Nowell could not help but think—

attributes.text: 'If I could die, would I die with the same expression on my face?'

attributes.content: Clovisia!
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: —Argh!
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: The aftershock sends gravel flying, like a fowlbeast shaking off water after a rain. It is quick, scattered, and unpredictable.
Nowell did not even have time to check Clovisia for signs of life.
No...
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: As the place threatens to shake itself apart, he bends over and protects the child from falling rocks with his own body. The sharper pieces easily pierce his clothes and skin, digging deep into flesh and bone.
He remains unmoving, clenching his teeth, waiting for the tremors to cease.
He is awakened from his pained trance by the sound of crying.
The boy had awoken to find himself in a dark, unfamiliar underground space. Following his instincts, he began to cry helplessly.
Good morning, Ollie.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: It'll be okay. Everything will be okay. I'm here... it's Nowell.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: *cough*, *cough*...
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: We've met before, remember?
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: The aftershocks cease. Carrying Ollie with one hand and supporting himself with the other, he forces himself to sit up, pushing the weight off his back.
Fortunately, it is broken fragments of rock rather than a single, heavy slab, but he can still taste blood in his mouth as he moves.
In his arms, the child shakes his head helplessly in the darkness, hardly able to see anything.
...Clovisia.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: She saved your life... I'll get you out safely.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Then I'll come back... to bring her back. This is no resting place for her.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Nowell sits down, puts the trembling boy on the ground, and reaches behind to pull the fragments out from his own back.
The boy grabs Nowell's clothes.
Don't worry, I'm not leaving you behind.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: (Shakes head)
attributes.name: Quiet Child

attributes.content: It's okay. It won't kill me.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Nothing can.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: A smile, understood only by him, appears on his lips. Meanwhile, his fingers locate the final fragment, lodged between his scapula.
He grits his teeth and pulls it out.
Argh...
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Did I spook you, Ollie? Sorry.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Don't worry. Come with me, and I'll get you out. Whatever it takes.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Enduring pain had become a habit. Nowell lifts the child again and searches his memory for a path that will take them to safety.
I came from... this way.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Hang in there, Ollie. We'll get you out soon. Your parents are waiting—
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: (Shakes head)
attributes.name: Quiet Child

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: (Struggles)
attributes.name: Quiet Child

attributes.content: Uh—
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: You want to get down? It's quicker and safer if I carry you. Don't you want to see your mum sooner?
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: (Jumps down)
attributes.name: Quiet Child

attributes.content: ...Alright. Stick close to me, and don't let go.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: The child nods and grabs the corner of Nowell's clothes. He even wraps it around his palm tightly without being told, indicating that he understands Nowell.
Alright. Let's—
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: ...You have walked a long path...
...Poor soul...
Suddenly, he hears an ethereal voice echoing in every direction.
A mist spreads in the darkness, surrounding him.
Why have you come?
Nowell can recognize that voice anywhere.
He cannot move. A sudden, cold fury buffets his reason, nailing him to the spot.
What do you want?
Stop.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: He does not know why the voice chose this moment to appear. Instinctive mistrust overcomes all judgment.
Stop your parlor tricks.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: I thought you wanted to meet me.
What are you talking about?!
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Who are you? Where are you?
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: I am here. You came for me, and I came for you.
All you need to do... is open your eyes.

Nowell has never seen the owner of the voice, nor gathered any clues about their appearance. Over the long years, all he could do was to piece together rumor after rumor, letting questions simmer into hatred.
If this voice is real and not his imagination, then it must...
Is that so? Then I'm sure you can tell me...
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Are you the wish-granting fairy? Or the powerful 'Nation's Sentinel'?
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: The unicorn, hidden in the shadows of history, is both benefactor and villain.
I am all that, and none of that.
attributes.name: Unicorn

attributes.content: I am merely here now to promise reparation to you, poor soul.
attributes.name: Unicorn

attributes.content: You don't even know my name. What I went through must have been insignificant, hardly a footnote to a legend like you, compared to the affairs you've meddled with.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: That is untrue.
attributes.name: Unicorn

attributes.content: You harbored a possibility that I placed hope in. How would one little weed of unknown breed grow if it never wilts? And how will it affect the lands around it?
attributes.name: Unicorn

attributes.content: That was my thought when I bestowed immortality upon you. What should have been a blessing.
attributes.name: Unicorn

attributes.content: Blessing. Pft.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Your arrogant 'blessing' has brought me nothing but an eternity of pain.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: ...That was not my intention.
attributes.name: Unicorn

attributes.content: But that's what it became. Death by a thousand cuts, except you wouldn't even let me die!
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: It's nothing but a curse!
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: I understand your anger.
attributes.name: Unicorn

attributes.content: Tell me. What will make you feel better?
attributes.name: Unicorn

attributes.content: ...Hah.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: What, will you 'bestow' another 'blessing' upon me?
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Nowell can feel the child grab his clothes even tighter.
Can you hear me, Ollie?
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: (Nods)
attributes.name: Quiet Child

attributes.content: This voice is a liar. Don't listen to it. Don't think about it.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: I'll take you out of here.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Whoever you are, you can ask those legendary heroes who dance with you. Me, I'm leaving.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Few are those who hold the helm in the tides of history.
attributes.name: Unicorn

attributes.content: Are you complaining? To me?
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: ...If you consider my blessing a curse, I might offer you reparations.
attributes.name: Unicorn

attributes.content: Make a wish. What is it that you want?
attributes.name: Unicorn

attributes.text: A name, thinks Nowell. Just a name. This bastard, this villain who stands ever on high because of her powers, has long forgotten the weed's name.

attributes.content: You have a chance... You have already gained much more than the common man.
attributes.name: Unicorn

attributes.text: She must be filled with pity as she gazes upon me—
'You poor, insignificant creature. I will help you. I will help you, always.'
'Let us wipe away the tragic past with a beautiful future.'

attributes.content: Haha.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Have you made up your mind?
attributes.name: Unicorn

attributes.content: Let's go, Ollie. We've wasted enough time here.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: (Grabs Nowell's clothes tightly)
attributes.name: Quiet Child

attributes.content: Yes, child, I'm here.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Don't be afraid of the voice. It's just a bad guy, no different from the ones ravaging the city above.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: I'll come back to catch it later. But first, I need to get you out.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Phew...
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: —It's Ollie! Mr. Nowell found him!
attributes.name: Excited Worker

attributes.content: Over here! A hand!
attributes.name: Excited Worker

attributes.content: Careful, child.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: I'll lift you up. Take it easy—
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: No worries, sir! I'm up here! I'll grab him!
attributes.name: Excited Worker

attributes.content: Your turn, Mr. Nowell! Are you hurt? Do you need a hand?
attributes.name: Excited Worker

attributes.content: No need.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.text: Nowell clambers up friskily, but stops at the edge of the tunnel entrance rather than walking towards the crowd gathered not too far away.
He looks up again at the sun shrouded by thick clouds. It is one of countless sunrises he has seen, but this one is a little different, because of those who have lived to see it.

attributes.content: Ollie! My baby!
attributes.name: Panicked Woman

attributes.content: Oh, the fright you gave me! Next time, I'm holding onto you and never letting go... I won't let this happen again!
attributes.name: Panicked Woman

attributes.content: Wh-Where did this blood come from? Are you hurt?
attributes.name: Panicked Woman

attributes.content: (Shakes head)
attributes.name: Quiet Child

attributes.content: Strange, I don't see any wounds...
attributes.name: Panicked Woman

attributes.content: (Looks at Nowell)
attributes.name: Quiet Child

attributes.content: Ollie, where's the lady who found you first? Is she still...
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: (Shakes head)
attributes.name: Quiet Child

attributes.content: She wasn't down there?
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: (Shakes head)
attributes.name: Quiet Child

attributes.content: Oh, you're always like this... Well, it's all good. I'm so glad you came back safely.
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: Thank you so much, Mr. Nowell—
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: The man waves at Nowell with something other than anxiety or panic on his face.
It is a smile of gratitude, with a sincerity that makes Nowell awkward. All he can do is nod and smile back.
You're... welcome...
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: But the man keeps walking until he is right in front of him, and reaches out a hand, as though words alone cannot express his gratitude. And so Nowell keeps the smile on his face and shakes the extended hand, almost unconsciously.
Only then does he finally realize that pain is spreading, from his back to his chest to the rest of his body. He has difficulty breathing and bends down, grabbing his own collar.
The wounds he received from the rubble have still not started to heal.
—Sir? Are you okay?!
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: My goodness, your back! I didn't realize you were so badly injured—we have to find a doctor!
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: Oh, how silly of me, you're a doctor yourself...
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: I'm... injured?
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Th-The wound on your back! It's still bleeding! It's so big... and there's more than one!
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: Are they not healing yet?
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: N-No. That's normal for us, but I suppose it must be strange to you.
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: What happened down there? How did you get hurt?
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: That leader of the Self-Salvation Corps is down there too, isn't she?
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: She protected Ollie. I have to do something for her... At least bring her body back.
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: Clovisia.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Her name was Clovisia? That does ring a bell now that you mention it. I didn't even get a good look at her before it all happened.
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: I heard she was a great woman.
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.text: I'm the leader of the Londinium Self-Salvation Corps. You can call me Clovisia.
'I am all that, and none of that.'
We cannot promise a reward either.
'I am merely here now to promise reparation to you, poor soul.'
I'm afraid we don't have time to discuss this...
'Tell me. What will make you feel better?'

attributes.content: A great woman?
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Hah...
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: I don't...
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: I don't know.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: Clovisia... he had passed right by the one he spent his entire life looking for, without even realizing it.
But it is no longer important. With great effort, Nowell looks up, fighting against the pain and difficulty of breathing.
In his blurry vision, he sees a child clutching his mother's hand tightly. The boy is the very picture of health, his hair and skin a warm color, with a smile on his face, just like...
I-I'll take you to the Self-Salvation Corps! Or the Exemplars! They must have medics!
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: No...
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: What? Why?
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: M-Mr. Nowell! Are you okay?
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: Hang in there!
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: Nowell falls to his knees, no longer able to support his own weight. It is as though the fatigue of a hundred years of wandering has come upon him in an instant.
Before his hands and feet grow cold from blood loss, he curls his body down, ignoring the searing pain as the wounds on his back stretch, until his head touches the ground.
It is a posture of worship and reverence, but he is not praying to anyone.
He lifts his head after a little while.
The leader of the Self-Salvation Corps was not in the ruins.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: The pain lingers, as does the urge to cry his heart out. But all is silent, and only the beating of the heart resonates in his chest.
The thing that would make him happy, the thing that can kill him... it is already here.
What was that?
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: Clovisia wasn't there.
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: What about your injuries—
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: Right now, rather than spending my time on futile efforts...
attributes.name: Nowell

attributes.content: I should spend it on saving more people.
attributes.name: Nowell
